required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cabozantinib Post First-line Immuno-oncology Checkpoint Inhibitor Containing Combination
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicentre, Retrospective, Non-interventional Review of Electronic Prescribing Records of Any Second-line (2L) Patients and Chart Notes of 2L Cabozantinib Patients, Investigating the Treatment Sequence Pathway Following a First-line, Immuno-oncology Checkpoint Inhibitor (1L IO) Containing Combination Therapy in Patients With Advanced Renal Cell Carcinoma (aRCC) (CARINA)

brief_summary.textblock: This study will collect real-world data for the new treatment pathways for all patients with Advanced Renal Cell Carcinoma (ARCC) who were treated with a 1L IO (first-line, Immuno-Oncology checkpoint inhibitor) combination therapy and progressed to a 2L treatment with particular focus to understanding where cabozantinib is prescribed after 1L IO containing combination therapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Description of the treatment sequence pathway from 1L up to 2L for patients with aRCC
primary_outcome.time_frame: From start of treatment to last hospital follow-up or date of death whichever occurs first assessed during data collection period (from 15th of January 2015 until September 2022)
primary_outcome.description: To be described for patients with aRCC receiving 2L treatment following a 1L IO containing combination therapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Description of the treatment sequence pathway from 1L up to the 2L for cabozantinib patients with aRCC
primary_outcome.time_frame: From start of treatment to last hospital follow-up or date of death whichever occurs first assessed during data collection period (from 15th of January 2015 until September 2022)
primary_outcome.description: To be described for patients with aRCC receiving 2L treatment and subsequent lines of treatment following a 1L IO containing combination therapy.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of treatment to last hospital follow-up or date of death whichever occurs first assessed during data collection period (from 15th of January 2015 until September 2022)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Treatment Discontinuation (TTD) by line
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start date of first cycle of treatment to start date of last cycle of treatment during data collection period (from 15th of January 2015 until September 2022)

secondary_outcome.measure: Physician defined Best Response by line - complete response, partial response, stable disease, progressive disease
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of treatment to last hospital follow-up or date of death whichever occurs first assessed during data collection period (from 15th of January 2015 until September 2022)

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Response Rate (ORR) by line -complete response or partial response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of treatment to last hospital follow-up or date of death whichever occurs first assessed during data collection period (from 15th of January 2015 until September 2022)
From start date of first cycle of treatment to start date of last cycle of treatment during data collection period (from 15th of January 2015 until September 2022)

secondary_outcome.measure: Drug start and end dose by line
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of treatment to last hospital follow-up or date of death whichever occurs first assessed during data collection period (from 15th of January 2015 until September 2022)
secondary_outcome.description: Descriptive statistics using following parameters: no dose change, dose change, dose increase and dose decrease

secondary_outcome.measure: Disease Control Rate (DCR) by line - complete response, partial response and stable disease
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of treatment to last hospital follow-up or date of death whichever occurs first assessed during data collection period (from 15th of January 2015 until September 2022)

secondary_outcome.measure: Progression Free Survival (PFS) by line for cabozantinib patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of treatment to last hospital follow-up or date of death whichever occurs first assessed during data collection period (from 15th of January 2015 until September 2022)
From start of treatment to last hospital follow-up or date of death whichever occurs first assessed during data collection period (from 15th of January 2015 until September 2022)
secondary_outcome.description: Descriptive statistics using the following parameters: radiological disease progression, clinical deterioration, AE, subject's decision, Investigator's decision, end of predefined treatment, other

secondary_outcome.measure: Reason for dose change (Disease progression, AE, subject non-compliance, subject decision, clinical / Investigator decision, radiotherapy(s), surgery(s), COVID-19 pandemic, other)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of treatment to last hospital follow-up or date of death whichever occurs first assessed during data collection period (from 15th of January 2015 until September 2022)
From start of treatment to last hospital follow-up or date of death whichever occurs first assessed during data collection period (from 15th of January 2015 until September 2022)

secondary_outcome.measure: Cause of death (RCC or non RCC related)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of treatment to last hospital follow-up or date of death whichever occurs first assessed during data collection period (from 15th of January 2015 until September 2022)

study_pop.textblock: The study will be conducted in 10 UK hospitals that have patients who have been treated with a 1L IO containing combination therapy and have progressed to, and started, a 2L treatment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with a diagnosis of aRCC.
- Patients aged â‰¥18 years at aRCC diagnosis treated with a 1L IO containing combination therapy who have progressed to a 2L treatment.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient's hospital medical records are unavailable for review;
- Patients have started a 2L treatment as part of a Renal Carcinoma Treatment (RCT).
